summary:
The Battle of Hastings (1066) was a major event in English history. It was fought between the Norman-French army led by William, Duke of Normandy, and the English army commanded by King Harold Godwinson. The Normans won, starting a new era in England.

King Edward's death led to a power struggle. Harold became king but faced invasions. After defeating one enemy, he marched south to meet William. The battle lasted all day. Harold died, and his army lost. William became king on Christmas Day. This battle marked the beginning of Norman rule in England. Many people died, and William built a monastery to remember the event.
title: Battle of Hastings
